website_summaries.verdict: Extremely low price for 3 water detection units. Offers a loud alarm, so you're sure to hear it.
pros: If you need multiple water detection sensors at a low price, this set gives you a great value
The 9-volt batteries to operate these sensors are included
Extremely loud alarm on the base unit of 130 decibels
Relatively easy to install with a suction cup or adhesive tape
cons: Sensor's wire to attach to the base unit is less than 4 feet long, which is shorter than most

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on mostly positive reviews. The were shipped promptly, but upon receiving them I immediately installed the batteries and tested them. The first one did nothing when the sensor was immersed in water. The second one did nothing. The third one worked as expected. If they all worked like the 3rd one, I would have been happy, but under these circumstances I have no confidence in them and they will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, but the working units function fine.
customer_reviews.text: Quality control is a big concern. 1 of 3 units doesn't work. A wire wasn't welded properly. See the picture. The other two units work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mobutoni

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work
customer_reviews.text: My basement flooded this morning. The alarm that I purchased in May either did not go off or could not be heard. It started making a weak sound when I pulled it out of the water! Here I was with a false sense of confidence that i would be alerted if something went wrong with my sump pumps. this is the second water seepage alarm i have purcahsed from Amazon and neither one worked.
customer_reviews.author: donnal

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in test so assume it will work fine if ...
customer_reviews.text: Works Great in test so assume it will work fine if I get a leak. Simple to use and easy to set up. Very Happy. Gave purchase info to my plumber, he said he'll buy some for customers... Thank you, Lee 3 days after new hot water heater, got a signal that I had a leak. Signal was loud and constant. Leak turned out to be the Air Condition water evaporation drain was connected to water tank drain that was plugged so it back-up into water tank drain pan. I got the signal early enough to prevent leak from causing any damage as heater is in closet upstairs bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal and very effective and loud. Re-usable and simple design.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and effective. Even come with batteries. These can be re-used after detection, just dry off the sensor. They are loud, loud enough for me not to want to be in the same room when its going off. I just wish they came with some 3m Scotch dual fastener strips (the better Velcro stuff). The included double sided tape is a one shot kind of deal when you have to swap out the battery. Some other brands (which battery lasts almost forever) rely on a compressed sponge internally that expands in water and sets off the alarm, but its a one shot deal and some go off from a very humid Chicago summer day.
customer_reviews.author: RomanS

customer_reviews.title: You must be kidding.
customer_reviews.text: 3 able bodied adults tried for 30 minutes to remove the back to insert the battery. No instructions or even an arrow. Press on the tabs and pushed and pulled and pried with no luck . Back they went
customer_reviews.author: mark weiss

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't as easy as it should have been.
customer_reviews.text: First impressions: Well packaged, comes with battery, and adhesive tape. Setting up: To put in the battery you need to remove the back, which wasn't as easy as it should have been. Whats more, you really have to try to fit the battery in there with the limited space. And then on top of that there are two screws that it comes with, which after putting in the battery you would secure the back cover with. Other devices are much easier to setup. Operation: The suction cup isn't the greatest, but will work on very smooth surfaces. Was setup with the adhesive tape to the basement floor. Was triggered when got wet. Works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rus Russo

customer_reviews.title: replacing old ones
customer_reviews.text: Receive these today ....all three of them worked fine with the enclosed batteries. Yes the batteries are a little tight but that's okay. I will upgrade the batteries to an Energizer or Duracell battery but these things really help save our cellar when you're prone to flooding.. disaster averted last big rain storm, woke us up at 2am because my sump pump was clogged with leaves. I am also placing one under my hot water storage tank and one behind the washing machine all of which are also in the cellar.
customer_reviews.author: resq2piper

customer_reviews.title: Product works as advertised - makes enough noise to get your attention
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and questions/answers. Thought I'd give the product a shot. My place is small enough and the alarm is loud enough to attract my attention no matter where I am. I've got an upstairs laundry area - with flow restrictors (if the armored hose bursts, the uncontrolled flow should be stopped). If water does get to the floor this alarm will alert me and prevent damage to the floor and kitchen below. I've got flooding issues in the garage - this will give me warning to get stuff off the deck. I'm impressed by the cost and performance. The only thing I have to make sure is to change out the batteries regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Capt

customer_reviews.title: All three work great and they are loud. If there's a leak you'll know about it.
customer_reviews.text: I tested all three and they worked perfectly. About 1/8 inch of water using the supplied stand and they sound off. And they are loud enough to hear throughout our house. Some reviewers said the battery was tight or wouldn't fit. I didn't find that. Put the battery in so the top of the battery is at the opposite end from where the wires enter. Then put the pigtail of the connector in the slot on the same side as the circuit board and it fits just right. It's tight but I didn't have an issue putting the battery in and closing the cover. Very good leak detector. Haven't tested the low battery beep because I just received them.
customer_reviews.author: Rod & Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Essential, yet easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Everybody who has a hot water heater in their home should have at least one of these. When boilers go, they usually leak a bit at first before they explode - at which point the results can be catastrophic. These small devices can at least give you some measure of control over what is going on in the far recesses of your basement. Absolutely essential for that, as well as for sump pumps or sewer drains that are prone to clog. This model has a very impressive decibel level, but you really want that for something sitting in your basement. Also includes some nice touches, such as batteries, suction cups and double-sided adhesive pads. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Monty Python

customer_reviews.title: Great value, works fine
customer_reviews.text: I only needed to use these short term and they worked great. I could literally build one out of parts in my electronics parts bin, but for this price why bother? I needed to detect an extremely thin layer of water on a concrete floor and it seemed to help to put some scrap cotton cloth in the sensor between the plates to wick up the water, so less depth was needed to trigger it. You may need to improvise mounting of the probes but that is easy. I am considering putting a lamp-cord type switch on the cable so I can quickly disable it without removing the battery or pulling the probe out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customr

customer_reviews.title: 2 of 3 sensors failed.
customer_reviews.text: Out of 3 units, 2 failed within 8 weeks. One won't shut off. The other went into alarm but I was not home and did not hear it so the battery died. When I replaced the battery, the unit began to smoke and fried. When they initially worked, I loved them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watson

customer_reviews.title: 3 weeks after getting this, it has saved me multiple times!
customer_reviews.text: We put these in a rental unit, after discovering that a leaking faucet had caused damage to brand new kitchen cabinets. Though it was a new faucet, it was apparently assembled incorrectly in the head of the faucet, and would leak down the pull-out head (invisible), and drip into the cabinet under the sink. Putting this detector in (with the toilet paper trick mentioned by another post) alerted us every time water leaked. We finally got the correct washer configuration, and appears to have stopped leaking, but having this alert SAVED THE CABINETS. The tenant was so impressed he's going to get some of these, too.
customer_reviews.author: Klutz

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for hard to reach areas
customer_reviews.text: These were very easy to install. I read the reviews but had none of the problems some folks spoke of. The cover popped off easily with the simple tip of a butter knife. The battery was snug but fit in well. A test showed the alarm was very loud. I took the great advice on another review and rolled a small piece of paper towel to wedge in the bottom slit of the contact plate so that water doesn’t have to puddle an 1/8 of an inch to be detected. I used the included two sided sticky pad to install the alarm. The suction cup did not hold tight on the side of my washer.
customer_reviews.author: KnowledgeIsPower

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: The water alarms all work! A little hard to get the back off to install the battery, but not too bad. The suction cup doesn't stick to the inside of a sink cabinet, but that's not a big deal. They are super loud when water touches the contacts! I am doing as another person recommended, put a small piece of toilet tissue under the contacts to wick up to the contacts quicker. This way the alarm goes off with just a small amount of water. Otherwise the contacts are about 1/16" up from the surface. When it comes to a kitchen cabinet, I don't want any water at all leaking. This is just a safeguard.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Dressing

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory, great price, poor design
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the very low price and high reviews, considering some of the negative comments. Although I'm satisfied with my purchase, I think some of the design elements are ridiculous. I'm not sure why the sensor isn't just in the bottom of the main unit, getting rid of the long cord and base stand, which doesn't stay down easily. I bypassed both and just used electrical tape to tape the sensor to the main unit. Also the base for the sensor elevates the sensor a bit too high. If water leaks in an emergency I need to know ASAP, not when it rises to that level.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: 2 WORKED GREAT WITH A LOUD ALARM WHICH IS WHAT I WAS ...
customer_reviews.text: GOT THE 3 ALARMS TODAY. HAD 1 PROBLEM. 2 WORKED GREAT WITH A LOUD ALARM WHICH IS WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR. THE 3RD ONE DID NOT WORK. AT FIRST I THOUGHT IT WAS THE BATTERY BUT WHEN I HOOKED THE CONTACTS TOGETHER THE ALARM SOUNDED. TURNS OUT THE SENSOR IS N. G. FOR WHAT THEY COST I'LL EAT THE BAD ONE. ALSO, THE ONLY THING SUCTION CUPS ARE GOOD FOR IS TO WAKE YOU UP IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT WHEN WHAT THEY WERE HOLDING HITS THE FLOOR. I WASN'T GOING TO USE THEM ANYWAY. IF NOT FOR THE BAD ONE I WOULD GIVE THEM 5 STARS.
customer_reviews.author: AHS

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and useless by design.
customer_reviews.text: 2 out of 3 units were defective out of the box. Wires that connect battery adapter to main board was not soldered properly. But even if it will be in working condition - sensor designed in a way that it will sense only very heavy leak, when watter level will be 3-4 mm, which defies the purpose in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Good Cheap Insurance
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these after a leaky pressure relief valve caused a flood in my basement. I have one with the sensor in the relief valves overflow bucket, another one at the bottom of my hot water tank, and the third one keeping an eye on my dehumidifier incase the condensate pump stopes working. The ONLY thing I don't like is that the sensor wire comes out of the TOP of the unit, so when you mount it on a nail or screw, the weight of the wire pulls the unit crooked. I know, I know, who cares, they're in my basement and no one is looking at them anyway...
customer_reviews.author: Moody

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I put the sensor in a floor sewer cleanout to warn me if the sewer backs up before it comes up to floor level. One day some doofus puts too much soap in the washing machine and causes suds/foam in the drain line. The alarm went off with only soap suds contacting it, very nice sensitivity. Can't hear the alarm (a loud, steady high pitched tone) upstairs too well. Maybe if it was a pulsing tone it would be better. I will try to extend the sensor wire with some phone wire to the upstairs floor if I ever get a round tuit. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Not of the Herd

customer_reviews.title: We got these after a sump pump failures and a ...
customer_reviews.text: We got these after a sump pump failures and a dishwasher leak caused problems. After we installed these, someone unplugged the sump pump and forgot to plug it back in--suddenly we heard the little alarm screaming to tell us that the water level was getting too high! Crisis averted, thanks to this device.
customer_reviews.author: J Russ

customer_reviews.title: LOUD and everything you need
customer_reviews.text: My wife and i bought these after we had some problems with our fridge leaking and then our AC unit in our attic leaking as well. We tested these out by closing the circuit with a wet finger and they are LOUD. Definitely loud enough to wake you up if there were a problem while sleeping. Comes with everything you need to place these where you need them. Only tip i would have it maybe add a bit of thin adhesive to the bottom of the water sensor base things to keep them upright.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Jess

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product and Value Great Customer Service From Instapark
customer_reviews.text: This is a package of three sensors. It includes the necessary batteries foam mounting strips, and wires and plastic housing to provide added protection for water damage to your abode. I have ordered two of these sets, and one out of the six sensors did not function well (its alarm was about 100 decibels too quiet). I contacted Instapark to see how I might repair it, and they sent me a replacement immediately, no questions asked. I would recommend this product highly as some cheap insurance for very serious and expensive water damage, and most of all due to the seller's customer service and standing by their product.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Ginley

customer_reviews.title: Saved me THREE TIMES
customer_reviews.text: So after a failed sump pump and a completely ruined finished basement, my plumber told me about water alarms. Did my research and found this set. I have to tell you, this has saved me THREE additional times!!! The sound is not loud enough to hear on my top floor (Basement, Main, Top) but you hear it on the main floor. For such a small investment, it has saved me THOUSANDS of dollars!!!! I have them under my water main and filtration system, under my up-flush system, hanging down 10" in my sump pump, under my water heater and near my furnace/humidifier system. LIFE SAVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terra Good

customer_reviews.title: A lot of smoke!
customer_reviews.text: These are very light weight, there’s not much too them. It’s a little difficult to get the battery cover on. However, one of the three started pouring out thick, acrid smoke. Luckily, I was able to pull the battery before it started a fire. I’m not sure I trust the other two now. I’d spend more and get a better made unit if this will be placed inside a home.
customer_reviews.author: Redlstar

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment is exceedingly hard to open
customer_reviews.text: Devices were resistant to battery installation. Just an additional 1/16 of an inch in the enclosure's width would make all the difference. Devices were all responsive to moisture, and very loud. The ends of the sensing electrodes are not even with the base, so water would have to rise a bit to reach them before the alarm would sound. Did have to use a wad of tissue paper between the electrodes in order to wick water to them for a quick response. I will order another set to use in other areas of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L.

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly and they're LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: I installed three of these in various areas under and around our a/c air handler back at the end of 2018 after having to replace a section of my oak living room floor due to damage from the drip pan on our a/c unit backing up and overflowing. Earlier this month (June 2020) I heard a piercing shriek and discovered that the ac pan was leaking. The alarm had activated on less than a cup of water. We were able to correct the problem with the drain pan before the water got anywhere near the wood. Saved our floor. I would absolutely recommend these little beauties!
customer_reviews.author: eevelyn

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed, h8’s gonna h8
customer_reviews.text: I checked all 3 alarms and they worked flawlessly. The standby current is 10uA and with an energizer (not the one that came with the unit) battery you should get a couple of years of battery life out of this thing. The alarm is appropriately loud and annoying. The low battery chirp also works well at below 7V. I have put up a video of battery installation for all the people that don’t have patience. All in all as an engineer I think the device works as advertised. Best of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Averyl Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Could have saved me many headaches if I would have had these earlier.
customer_reviews.text: These devices are wonderful. In the past, I have had to remove an inch or so of water from my basement when the water heater leaked, and again when my water softener leaked. This would have saved me hours of cleanup and drying. I tested them in the sink and they are very loud. Trouble always seems to happen in the middle of the night when we are sleeping. I feel much better now knowing they are waiting to let me know of any uninvited water around my utility equipment. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne in Indy

customer_reviews.title: Prevented water damage
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when we first moved into our new house about 2 years ago and completely forgot about them. This morning we heard one of them go off from under our kitchen sink. Apparently it detected a small leak that had already built up a small puddle of water. Thanks to this handy little device we were able to clean up and fix the problem before actual damage occurred. Just be aware of how loud it is - my ears are still ringing. I couldn’t get the sensor dry enough to turn off, so I had to unscrew the back to remove the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Works ok so far
customer_reviews.text: Like the product so far. it's loud and as described only reason I gave 4 is the process to register warranty. They send a little small card that hard to write on with pen it has like a coating on it. So have to use marker on it then can't get all info on hardly and you got to send just that card back,no copy or anything. Then you have to mail to California with technology they don't have online registration so afraid it could be way for them to say they never got it unless you want to pay extra to get tracking on it.Seems strange just saying
customer_reviews.author: T. Squires

customer_reviews.title: One out of the three arrived dead. However, ...
customer_reviews.text: One out of the three arrived dead. However, I revived it in several minutes by re-doing the soldering points on the back of the PCB. Obviously, I took the time to re-solder all three, just in case. All units work now as expected and they are very loud. Update: Instapark surprised me by replying to the review almost instantly and sent me a replacement unit. The greatest proactive support, I didn't even request a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Radu

customer_reviews.title: No confidence in the product
customer_reviews.text: I too saw the positive reviews and was disappointed when one out of the devices I received failed to work at all. A second one worked but would emit a low pop sound. It wasn't the low battery as I tried multiple batteries (New ones) and the sound persisted. The 3rd unit seemed to work but by that time I wasn't willing to risk having future issues so I will be returning them and look for something else. The units are inexpensive but seem poorly designed. The tolerances for the battery compartment are very tight and circuit board doesn't seem to be attached adequately.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Carter

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good water detecors
customer_reviews.text: When I got them I tested these and they seem to work very well. I have two of them under my kitchen sink where we have had trouble with water leakage. The noise stops and soon and you remove the sensor from water, and pull it out of plastic clip that's holding it, which is a good thing because trying to remove the batter is a big hassle. The design should really be changed to allow opening the unit to remove/replace the battery easier. Outside that they are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: N. L.

customer_reviews.title: SAVED my house from flooding MORE THAN ONCE!
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to install and is a life saver!!! More than once I have jumped up due to the sound on the alarm going off, and found someone spilling water that would have caused damage, freezer freezing up and no longer defrosting causing water to come out the front during defrost cycle. Washing Machine leaking water!!! YES, all of them, and got warning via this so I could react and correct the situation!!! AWESOME product, THANK YOU for the peace of mind this provides me as a home owner!
customer_reviews.author: daniel of the green isle

customer_reviews.title: 3-is-better-than-1 redundant water detectors
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy but reasonable shipping package and arrived on time. Reasonable price for 3. All units tested fine. The suction cup mounting wasn't acceptable so I replaced it with double-sided stick on velcro. That worked nicely to mount all boxes above the platform floor out of water harms way...hopefully never. I bought another brand product as a further backup but I prefer this model with its wired sensor and remote mounted alarm. The volume level of the alarm is acceptable but a bit faint for my insulated ground floor utility room...this volume seems higher than the norm. I plan on testing these units regularly but so far I'm pleased with the purchase and would recommend the product and seller.
customer_reviews.author: J Peter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to silence
customer_reviews.text: This device saved me. I like that it's easy to silence if it gets water on it, but if it's low battery, it's a little harder to open and to get the battery out. Would I still recommend it? Yes. I kind of with the sound could be louder, but next to it, it's really loud. In the basement when it went off, it sounded more like a warble upstairs, but it was still enough to get my attention (but not enough to wake me up) when my crock level in my sump got high. The price is really good too!
customer_reviews.author: Lisk9

customer_reviews.title: Wish we had this a year ago
customer_reviews.text: These alarms are great. A year ago our dishwasher leaked. We didn't know it was leaking because the sound baffling underneath it kept the water trapped. So the water soaked into our subfloor and then into our hardwood. Had to turn it in on insurance and ended up being a $13k repair. We bought these to put one under our dishwasher it works great. the dishwasher leaked again recently. The alarm sounded. When I looked under the dishwasher, it had only leaked maybe a few ounces of water when the alarm detected it. I will have an alarm under every dishwasher I own from now on!
customer_reviews.author: LadyB

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We've had a lot of water leaks in different spots in the house. Laundry room, water heater, AC pump, under sinks, etc. I wanted to get a number of these sensors without spending a ton of money and these are a great value. I bought 2 packs of 3. As others have said, the battery is a little tight, but just run the wires under the circuit board and put the battery connector at the far side and it will all fit. Tested with water and they work great. Hoping to never have another leak (ha) but happy to know that when there is one I'll be able to clean it up before the water causes damage.
customer_reviews.author: gdesignr

customer_reviews.title: Good product for peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: After our last rain storm the pump was going all night, and the idea of it breaking and having no idea was worrisome. The three pack is a great deal for the price, and allows more peace of mind since I can monitor multiple locations in the basement. Setup is relatively easy if you are patient. The battery compartment is somewhat difficult to open, and tight to fit the included 9-volt battery in. After setting up the first device, it was easier for the other two. I tested each with a small puddle and the alarm is audible throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: Catholic Father

customer_reviews.title: SEEM TO WORK FINE
customer_reviews.text: Had no problem with setup, but I read lots of reviews before attempting, after trying to get the cover open! Easy enough with flat screwdriver. Battery IS hard to seat, but do-able. Used the paper towel trick to make sure I didn't need a foot of water before the sensors catch it. So far, very happy with them -- all worked fine (and I had enough info from other reviews to put a pillow over the "speaker" before wetting the sensors).
customer_reviews.author: Bertie

customer_reviews.title: A must for every homeowner. These are amazing. They've saved our house!
customer_reviews.text: These things have saved my house - Easy to set in place - 4 foot cord reaches behind the fridge and under the toilet - Comes with screws, sticky pad, and suction cup if you want to mount the alarms - Best bang for your buck I've found on amazon
customer_reviews.author: Beau Chevassus

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the 130db alarm. I wanted to use this to alert me and others to leaks in a condominium. What annoys me the most is the incredibly difficult removal of the back plate to install the 9v battery. It is loud and the unit can be located away from the sensor. A suction cup or screws could be used to mount it. I just hope the battery lasts a long time! There are better choices available. Since I wrote this I discovered that using a small screwdriver to press in the tabs helped with opening the case. I still feel it should be simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Rich s

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, works well with loud alarm, and reasonably priced. Only complaint is that cover for battery is VERY difficult to get apart. Then, once you get it apart, the compartment is so tight you can barely get the battery back in without damaging the tiny little wires that connect the battery. I leave mine apart and use a velcro strap or a rubber band to hold it together. Small issue when you consider what you can save in prevention of water damage.
customer_reviews.author: GRITS

customer_reviews.title: A bargain
customer_reviews.text: I tested these with damp paper towels and they all emitted an ear-splitting alarm but I've (fortunately) not had to test them for reliability with any actual leaks. But these are cheapest that I could find and, in a condo where liability for leaking from one's unit to any units below can be very expensive, it seems like a good investment. And, when I thought about everywhere there could be potential leaks, I ended up ordering alot of these: Under washing machine, dishwasher, sink/garbage disposer, under sink in vanity unit and below shower mixer valve in any bathrooms.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Real screamers
customer_reviews.text: Very loud alarm, terrific, expect to hear it two floors away! All three sensors in package were functional. Required three hands and two flat blade screwdrivers to remove battery cover however, no instruction and not intuitive, but you depress one of the little tab/depressions on the end with one screwdriver, and your helper inserts screwdriver into crack and one corner of the cover pops, then do the other corner. Like other reviewers, I cut off the useless suction cup, but the included adhesive strips worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Works Great But Has A Design Limitation
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for a few weeks now and they work well. Nice and shrill when they go off. My only complaint is the design of the detector. It won't simply go off when a trickle of water comes in contact with the sensor. It has to have a standing amount of water (1/2"-1") to complete the circuit and trigger the alarm. Aside from that issue, I'm very happy with these. They've worked great to warn me if my sump pump is getting overwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S.

customer_reviews.title: Refrig leak detected.
customer_reviews.text: Had water under the freezer from unknown cause. Bought the leak detector to know when it leaked. Worked good. Alarm went off soon after the freezer defrost cycle. Discovered the plastic evaporator pan had a crack in the side from a metal tab pushing on the pan. Space along refrigerator edge was too narrow for the holder so just taped it to side. Bad part is battery replacement. The compartment is a little too small making the battery fit super tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff proud USA Legal Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Saved Us Twice
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to go in two problem areas in our condo (the a/c closet and another closet, both of which have flooded before and led to extensive damage), and we have had a leak detected in both places in time to keep us from flooding. The alarm is extremely loud, which is great, given how we definitely don't want to miss the alert, and they were really easy to install. Overall a really great purchase that has already saved us hundreds, if not thousands of dollars in water damage.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Good product bad suction
customer_reviews.text: The battery compartment is a little difficult to open and will take a little time to get use to. The suction stinks it would not stick to my water heater for no longer than 5 minutes, so I had to use velcro to attach it. Other than those two minor issues it work very well and it's really loud (love that). Oh, and the seller is very good to work with. These guys aim to satisfy their customers. I will definitely purchase from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought these years ago. These are very compact, come with batteries and are LOUD!! I no longer have to worry about water collecting in my basement without me knowing about it. These would be great placed behind a refrigerator that uses a water filter for the ice maker (I learned this the hard way) as well as near your dishwasher and washing machine. This is a very cheap way to ensure if you get a water leak, you'll know before damage occurs.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy These!!!
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews about how hard it is to get the battery cover off are UNDERSTATEMENTS!!! I have now broken two nails... and I am a GUY! I'm ready to take a hammer to it! They may be good otherwise... I don't know... I can't put a battery in it to find out!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael McHale

customer_reviews.title: Real awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought one package of this item. It arrived quickly and was as described. I opened the package and assembled the dection alarm and tested it. When water touches the end of the unit, it makes a lot of noise. Each decter worked perfectly, so good that I immediately placed a second order. I am very pleased with these units and the affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: david t eib

customer_reviews.title: Buy multiple alarms for your house
customer_reviews.text: They work. Have them set up near my sump-pump, under numerous sinks/faucets, and by the furnaces. I have had them go off twice, and my guess is that I probably saved $10,000 in possible repair costs. I was home, so i could hear them, the only thing I'd like to see (and maybe someone else offers this already) is to have an email sent to me incase I'm not home or on vacation, I could have someone else check on any possible issues. But they've already paid for themselves multiple times over.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Very good value, and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Having suffered pin hole leaks in an aging copper pipe system I wanted to know of any new leak before any damage. Installed these in the wall adjoining the bathrooms through inspection panels I installed and sure enough one of the alarms alerted me to a small leak. The sensor blades are not flush to the work surface however so I ran a small strip of cloth along the bottom of sensor to bring it in intimate contact with any wet surface. Loud and sensitive. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I just received and installed these units - they are quite loud. I mounted one under a laundry sink. They are easy to install, but agree with other reviewers that the suction cups and/or self-adhesive strips are not great unless one is mounting the alarm enclosure onto a smooth surface. The remote sensor. There does not appear to be a way to secure the remote sensor (in this case to the floor), so I epoxied the the sensor mount to the floor, which works well. Overall, they seem well designed and well built, are loud and well priced, providing cheap insurance to flood or leak prone areas.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Conner

customer_reviews.title: obscenely loud and easy to use/install. a must have if you suspect water leak or need alerted
customer_reviews.text: absolutely a must if you are worried our suspect a water leak.. these are ear piercingly obscenely loud. instant response. modify the base as other users have done with added paper stuck in the gap..helps improve sensitivity and makes it respond to smaller spills to. but wow is it loud and quick to activate! very easy to use and comes with batteries which is a nice thoughtful plus.
customer_reviews.author: Flynngore

customer_reviews.title: Work great and you can hear them a LONG way away
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 11 months ago. I have 1 in each of my 2 a/c emergency drip pans and 1 in the pan under my hot water heater, all in my attic. This saved my bacon this past weekend - my evaporator coil started leaking into the a/c unit drip pan. The alarm went off WAY before I needed to worry about the pan filling and causing ceiling damage. I was at the back edge of my backyard (outside) and I could hear the alarm clearly. So glad I've got these!
customer_reviews.author: E. Van Cise

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but mine failed
customer_reviews.text: One of the units failed and went off for no reason. There was no water around. It just started to sound and couldnt be turned off. Because the battery cover is not easy to remove (has a screw), and the alarm sounding at 130db, I had to break it to remove the battery. I am glad I was home; otherwise it would have freaked out my wife or the nanny.
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: Good units
customer_reviews.text: everyone of these worked right out of the box. The best part is that batteries are included. I set the sensor on a paper towel so that it will wick up the water and sound the alarm sooner. Really happy with the units and I may purchase more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive and loud
customer_reviews.text: These trigger from a very small depth of water, and emit a piercingly loud siren. The set is a great deal, and none of the items in the two sets of three were defective. Please note my photos...I'm proud of the large, Super Glued nuts to help keep the sensor firmly on the ground, and the alarm unit placed in a quart Ziploc bag taped higher on the wall to stay clean and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Ted L.

customer_reviews.title: They worked, but the instructions are not too great
customer_reviews.text: All three of them worked. But the directions are very short, and not very informative. I finally went on youtube for a video of HOW to get the back out. Finally between the video, and trial and error, I realized that I could push in one of the buttons, then pry that part of the back off with a small screw driver, then to to the second one. I couldn't figure out how to pry it off without using 3 hands. I would prefer they had more room to put the batteries in.....
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Love the peace of mind it offers and not sure what others say but the included attachments to place on units to monitor works. A month later and unit is still in the areas I placed, no falling off. The sound is very loud and picked up by my leeo devices to phone me if they go off. The item comes nicely boxed and works perfectly. As I said the piece of mind having them by my basement hot water heater, my basement washer and basement freezer and knowing the sound is loud enough to be geared throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: redrover

customer_reviews.title: VERY LOUD - should do the job
customer_reviews.text: I tested this at my desk and couldn't believe how loud they are! Some time later I had to see a doctor for a 'loud' ringing in my ear. The doc asked me if I was exposed to any extreme noise. I said no, but later recalled the piercing sound this alarm gave off that one day and wondered if that was the reason. Anyway, my point is that it gives off an alarming amount of sound that should be heard throughout the house if water is leaking somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Edward B. Diederich

customer_reviews.title: Not too Loud
customer_reviews.text: The sensor is very sensitive. Only when water bridges the 2 metal tabs, does it go off. Once the water is gone, it stops. That's what I wanted, not something that stays on until you reset it. The alarm is loud enough to hear it across the house, but not loud enough to hear outside. I didn't want an alarm to wake the neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Warned us of an actual leak!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these alarms in October after a leak in my dishwasher caused damaged to my wood floor. placed one under the faulty water supply connection, one under the sink and one behind the refrigerator. Fast forward to New Years day and the alarm is going off under the dishwasher. I figure the battery must be saying time to replace. Nope. the connection leaked again. And the tinniest drop set off the alarm! So thankful for the warning that saved unwanted damages since the leak is in a location you can't see. Two thumbs up!!
customer_reviews.author: HellFrozeOver

customer_reviews.title: Works Well When Submerged
customer_reviews.text: Sensors should do the job with a significant amount of water. Tried setting them on a wet paper towel but would not activate. Had to immerse in water before they would work. Very loud piercing alert which is good. Very difficult to get the batteries installed. Had a hard time removing the covers and the battery is a real tight fit in the case. Might have been easier if there were instructions included. There was a small piece of folded paper that said Instruction Manual but it was blank except for the cover.
customer_reviews.author: MCK

customer_reviews.title: Good Value.  Works Well
customer_reviews.text: for $20 you can't go wrong. I've had these installed for 10 months now. All work well. I've just replaced the first battery (supplied) - so even the cheap batteries are okay. They work as advertised and are made well enough for a simple device. No fireworks, but no tears either. They do chirp when the battery is low to get your attention.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Anglo

customer_reviews.title: Great sensor for a low price
customer_reviews.text: These sensors work fine. The batter cover is a little tricky to open but no big deal. As for any reviewers who said they couldn't get the battery in, just put the connector end in first and then the battery should slip into place. I tried the trick with a bir of toilet paper folded and inserted in the channel where the sensor is placing the whole thing on a paper towel and it works great. Device now is much more sensitive to a larger area.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Kjellman

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what i want it to do
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of water that drains into our sump pit daily (~1000 gal) Bought this to notify me when the level was above normal since it needs to be fixed ASAP when the sump pump itself dies or has a problem. This is tied to the pipe so that it dangles about half way down. Turned off the pump and it alarmed as expected. Not sure how it would work on the floor, maybe a bit of kleenex in the sensor area to wick up the water / alarm sooner?
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very loud
customer_reviews.text: Like may reviews, I found the battery impossible to install without some modification. If the battery compartment was just 2mm wider it would be a 5 star review. Don't buy this unless you are willing to make some "adjustments" in order to use it. Poor battery fit aside, the device works well and is very loud.
customer_reviews.author: ALeon

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: After a recent water heater repair my plumber suggested getting leak alarms. I found this product among many on Amazon, and although the price seemed almost too good to be true, it had many positive reviews. With the security of an Amazon purchase I ordered the set of 3. They arrived today, with batteries included as promised. All 3 units appear to work perfectly. Hopefully I'll never know how they work in real time but from my test they are sensitive enough to detect small amounts of water, and loud enough to be heard throughout the house. Highly satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Stern

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Very loud and can be heard for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very loud and can be heard for the most part at different floor levels. I put one in a partition of my basement near a floor drain but wasn't sure if I could hear it up on my third floor so I extended the siren device with common speaker wire to the entry floor in the house so it could be heard from any floor in the house. Inexpensive and good insurance to give you a loud heads up when unwelcome water strikes so you can get to the clean up fast. Would be nice if there was a wire extension kit available to move the siren device to further away locations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as described... Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: Works as described... Great Price. I bought these after a HVAC maintenance check. The service person told me that they are a great safety net and described a few horror stories. Having 3 is great. I put on near my Hot Water Heater, One near my Washer and Dryer and one near my Refrigerator (ice makers can fail)
customer_reviews.author: Gary DZ

customer_reviews.title: Works for backed up drain alarm.
customer_reviews.text: Product works well. Product documentation was not good. Instruction book was blank. I use this for a drain that likes to back up occasionally, and since it is in a room where I don’t often visit, I needed something to tell me when it was time to clear the drain before it backed up and made a mess. This was the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Early water detection
customer_reviews.text: All units worked perfectly. I attached (hot glued) 4 pennies on the top of each sensor base so that there was sufficient weight to keep the sensor in place. I added a folded strip of paper towel to a slot under the sensor. This will allow a very small amount of water to wick up the paper towel and set the alarm off immediately without having to wait for the water to rise to the contacts level.
customer_reviews.author: doc

customer_reviews.title: A little more piece of mind for a minimal cost.
customer_reviews.text: A little more piece of mind for a minimal cost. All units worked and the 9v batteries were also all good. Time will tell how long they last. Option of using the bracket is good. Used the bracket for in the water heater tray, and did without on the one I dangled into the sump pit. The back cover fit on well enough to not need the screws in my opinion. It was a tight squeeze getting the battery in the tray, but good product other than that.
customer_reviews.author: POWERPRO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: In our condo, the hot water heater is in the foyer closet. It is important in a 12-story condo to be completely on top of any issues involving leaking water, so we ordered these alarms to make sure we're able to deal with any water issues promptly. We tested the alarms and they work as described. Can't ask for more. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 3?  How am I supposed to trust this?
customer_reviews.text: I placed two of the three alarms into our most important locations and confirm that they were working. Then I went to set up our third alarm and noted that it only erratically alarmed when there was water. They were many times it was soaked with water and did not alarm. I'm not sure whether to trust all three of these or whether this one is just defective...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I received this product the other day and was able to install the batteries and set all 3 with an hour (prob faster). The main place that I installed it was under the kitchen sink. I just installed a Reverse Osmosis system and a mat to catch the water. Just a side note on the mat I used, its a replacement pan for the Midwest dog crate. They run under $20. and it fit perfectly. It also has a nice lip on it to catch the water.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Works Great - Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up and installation. I tested two of the Instapark units prior to installing in the overflow pan of my hot water heaters, and both worked great. With 8 year old water heaters, (getting closer to their EOL,) the Instapark's provide me some peace of mind until the HWH's are ready to be replaced (10 year warranty). The alarm is loud enough that I'll easily hear it go off in my attic.
customer_reviews.author: LP Texas

customer_reviews.title: A simple and affordable water insurance policy
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of places in your house where water leaks can be catastrophic - your washing machine, your water heater, your sump pump. Failures or leaks can cause extensive water damage. This is a very simple electric circuit that is completed if the sensor gets wet. When that happens, you get a loud alarm so you know something is up. This one also has a low battery alarm so that you can keep the batteries fresh enough to alert you. It is not wifi enabled or internet connected, but hey it's like $5 a sensor. Like all insurance policies, this provides piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mankin

customer_reviews.title: works great! had to adjust them a little
customer_reviews.text: Installed them as directed but thy needed to have about 1/8 inch of water to work, I wanted them to go off if any water showed up, solution I duct taped the receiver to an old metric socket I had laying around, works perfect. Any water on the floor will trip the alarm. would I recommend them? yes. You may have to do a little modification if you want them to sound the alarm at less then 1/8 inch of water, but its pretty easy Sorry for the somewhat blurry picture
customer_reviews.author: J Clark

customer_reviews.title: No fuss under sink leak detector
customer_reviews.text: WOW! They work. Who knew something so simple could save you a lot of grief? I bought 3- one for each of my 3 sinks. I had sprung a slow leak in the bathroom, and this little simple product alerted me right away (the sink had just started to leak). You won't regret buying these. But you will regret waking up and finding a puddle under your sink or worse.
customer_reviews.author: Lydiah

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat tricky to get to lay flat on the monitored surface, but I don't see that as a negative - just have to pay attention. It provides flexibility for installation. The tape provided for the alarm section is strong. It is crazy loud - be prepared when testing the first time.
customer_reviews.author: v_roze

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost protection.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 for all the possible water hazards around the house. They all worked out of the box. To make them more efficient, I place a small piece of paper towel in each sensor so they would pick up moisture from any angle. Now I don't have to worry about a leaking sink drain or cracked ice maker hose (which I experienced). I did not use the suction cup.
customer_reviews.author: Ret Leo

customer_reviews.title: Instapark IWA-10 Water Leak & Overflow Alert Alarm
customer_reviews.text: All 3 work as advertised. Loud enough, but not as high as advertised. These will be adequate for our needs. I followed other comments as to weighting the base down, prior to placement. I used 2-ea, 1/2” heavy galv. nuts, glued with Gorilla Glue to the plastic base at opposite corners, away from the contact plug. Thank You for a product with a reasonable cost for the 3 ea units!
customer_reviews.author: Alan R.

customer_reviews.title: Very loud!
customer_reviews.text: Recently got 4" of water in my basement after sump pump failed so I thought some water alarms would be a good idea. Just received these the other day and installed them. They set off an ear splitting alarm when dipped in water so I'm fairly confident they will wake me up if we get water in the night again. The only negative is the suction cups seem worthless. I was not able to get them to stick to anything. I used the provided double sided tape instead.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud Alarm!
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to give an accurate rating until the product detects a leak but I did test it and it does send out an ear piercing alarm when the sensor comes in contact with water. If it detects a leak in my water heater and warns me before I have a real mess on my hands, it will be well worth the price I paid. I do feel more relaxed knowing that it is on guard 24 hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: Johno

customer_reviews.title: water leak detector that really works
customer_reviews.text: A must have for you water heater. As we know water heaters don't last long. 8-10 years normally..so if it leaks it can cause massive problems. This alarm will give you some feeling of safety from an unwanted flood. Any place you could have a leak like toilet, dishwasher, bathtub or sink run over... (A 9 volt replacement power supply may help so you don't have to change batteries yearly.)
customer_reviews.author: DR. Mckinley

customer_reviews.title: Simple and very basic to use. Uses easy to buy 9v batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Love the simplicity of the product, no routers or wifi to connect to. Does what it is designed to do, which is alert you to water that is sensed through a leak or a broken pipe. Loud enough to hear from 2nd floor. Very cheap investment to protect your bigger investment: your home. Sellers are great as well, fast communication and excellent service. Will definitely buy more for our other rooms, at such a great price, why not?
customer_reviews.author: John Tran

customer_reviews.title: They don't work
customer_reviews.text: I placed brand new batteries in 2 of the devices, and within 3 months, I had leaks, and neither went off. Battery completely drained. For a passive device, that is an insane amount of battery usage. Smoke detectors last longer than that on the same battery, performing a very similar service
customer_reviews.author: Max Saperstone

customer_reviews.title: Buy These!
customer_reviews.text: These are loud! I bought three and they all work great and are ear piercing loud! I just bought three more. One under water heater. Three beneath three different aquariums, two in window wells which have been known to leak. May buy three more for use beneath built-in dishwasher, another beneath washing machine, and another for a spare!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Not as loud as a fire alarm, but close. Tested unit, holder is 1/16 inch thick at bottom, I put unit on flat plate, alarm went off when puddle surrounded unit. I did try the toilet paper between the contacts suggestion. This increased the sensitivity greatly. I would not trust the suction cup. The battery compartment is very tight to remove. Tight in placing battery in. Included is three 9v batteries which is nice. Overall I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: These Work Well
customer_reviews.text: These work very well. The most difficult part about installing them was pulling the back cover off to put in the battery. They are extremely loud, so I’m not worried that we won’t be able to hear them. Four stars because I wish the cable from the sensor to the box was a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Good value - but no low battery warning.
customer_reviews.text: Have put several of them around the house, and one has triggered twice letting us know of a problem. I use the trick with the rolled up paper towel under the sensor to help make sure the water will touch the sensor sooner. The only issue is there is no low battery warning.
customer_reviews.author: DanH

customer_reviews.title: Needs quite a bit of water to activate.
customer_reviews.text: Today I found my alarm sensor sitting in silence on a wet paper towel. It wouldn’t sound until I pressed the sensor into the wet towel. It wasn’t enough that there was water in the floor that soaked into the paper towel. Not nearly as sensitive as I would have hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Life saver.
customer_reviews.text: We had some issues with flooding in our area and got these as a backup in case the sump pump stopped working. The good news is the sump pump kept working as it should but one of our outside faucets was leaking Into the basement and this was a life saver and let us know right away. Love that there are 3 of them and they come with the batteries already
customer_reviews.author: samanthaxirene

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: These little beauties actually work very well. And they come complete with batteries included! I ordered two three packs of theses detectors. I tested all six and also the batteries. They work as advertised but you can improve the sensitivity by taking a small piece of dry paper towel and folding it to fit in the slot under the sensor. As soon as the paper towel gets the least bit damp the sensor will trip.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

product_meta.title: Instapark Water Leakage Detection Alarm and Sensor, Low Battery Alert
product_meta.description:
In the U.S., water damage is the 2nd most frequently filed insurance claim and has accounted for more than $5 billion of claims each year in recent years. Property damage and monetary loss aside, a water-damaged property could also pose great health risks to its inhabitants, a truly nightmare scenario for homeowners. Thanks to the Instapark IN07A automatic water leakage alarm, a simple, inexpensive yet effective device, you now have a solution to minimize the risk of water damage and avoid its unpleasant aftermath. 

Powered by a single 9V alkaline battery (included), the IN07A features a main alarm unit with a 130 dB siren connected together with a water detection sensor by a 44” long wire. When properly placed on the floor or any flat surface area to the monitored, the sensor will automatically detect any presence of water and trigger the main unit alarm to go off at 130 dB to alert the occupant to take immediate actions. Suitable locations to place the sensor include under-the-sink cabinet in a kitchen or bathroom, near a water heater, a sump pump, a toilet, a washer, a humidifier, an AC unit, or ice-making refrigerator. For added convenience, a bottom plate is included to help secure the sensor in place and lower the sensitivity if so desired. The main alarm is easily mountable as high as 44” above the floor, on a flat surface with either its built-in suction cup or included double-sided adhesive foam tape. 

Specifications: 

Power source: 9V x 1 (included) 
Wire length: 44 inches 
Dimensions: 2 ¾ X 2 ½ X 1 ¼ inches (main alarm unit) 
Weight: 2.4 oz (without battery) 
Battery life: 2 years minimum 
Siren sound level: 130 dB 
Minimum detectable water depth: 1/32 inches

What’s in the box: 

IN07A water alarm, 3 of each
Bottom plate
Double-side adhesive foam tape pad
User instruction
Warranty registration

Powerful 130-dB alarm travels up to 100 yards, from end-zone to end-zone
Advanced and sophisticated solid state circuitry ensures long-term sensitive and reliable operation
Easy to remove, easy to clean double-sided adhesive foam tape pad included and built-in suction cup for easy attachment to an appliance
44-inch long wire extends far and beyond
